description.p: Vesktop is a customizable and privacy friendly Discord desktop app!
Vesktop comes bundled with Venmic, a purpose-built library to provide functioning audio screenshare.

ul.li: Fixes Screenshare with audio not starting
Added taskbar flashing on new notifications
Fixed some issues with camera/virtual camera sharing
Fixed Screenshare UI black text
Fixed macOS vibrancy feature not working
Fixed a text rendering issue in Vesktop windows (About, etc)
Fixed start minimised not working when Splash is disabled
Upgraded to Electron 39.2.7, bringing in various Electron/Chromium fixes
Hardened Security by enabling strict Sandboxing and tweaking Electron fuses
Added proper Vesktop splash animation, made by @khcrysalis
Added option to use nearest neighbour scaling (for pixel art) to the splash optimisation
Fixed Vesktop not correctly remembering its position on some multi-monitor Windows systems
Fixed missing Notification icon on Windows
Fixed auto-start minimized not working
Fixed an edge case where on some systems text wouldn't render correctly
Fixed the first command line argument being ignored
Now runs in Wayland on Linux by default
Vesktop now has a new icon, including a Liquid Glass icon for MacOS
You can now customise the splash animation and tray icon (https://github.com/Vencord/Vesktop/pull/1179)
Added the option to auto start the app minimised
Added autostart support to the Vesktop flatpak
The ping count badge should now show more reliably on Linux
Vesktop updates are no longer forced. From now on, they will open an Update notice popup with the changelog and options to update now, remind later, or ignore an update entirely (not recommended)
Fixed Vesktop registering itself as the default app for HTML files (this is actually an Ubuntu bug)
Added cli options to spoof Vesktop's user agent, useful for bypassing Discord's recent VPN Linux block
Fixed spellcheck by @Covkie
Moved arrpc server into a worker thread to fix small stutters
Fixed Video Hardware Acceleration setting sometimes being wrongly disabled
Fixed random Discord logouts
Updated Electron & Chromium - should fix various graphical glitches
Starting a screenshare on Windows will no longer mute system audio
Fixed showing "Invalid URL" errors in some edge cases (spotty network)
Now respects your Autogain preference
Improved the flow for linking third party accounts
Fixed issue that would cause the AppImage to have no icon and be unpinnable
Added the ability to screenshare with stereo audio
Added Video Hardware Acceleration switch - Used to always be enabled. Now it is opt-in (disabled by default) to fix graphical glitches that were affecting many users
Fixed Discord titlebar buttons
Fixed "Object has been destroyed" error in some edge cases
